arabicText: وَلَمَّا فَتَحُوا۟ مَتَـٰعَهُمْ وَجَدُوا۟ بِضَـٰعَتَهُمْ رُدَّتْ إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا مَا نَبْغِى ۖ هَـٰذِهِۦ بِضَـٰعَتُنَا رُدَّتْ إِلَيْنَا ۖ وَنَمِيرُ أَهْلَنَا وَنَحْفَظُ أَخَانَا وَنَزْدَادُ كَيْلَ بَعِيرٍۢ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ كَيْلٌۭ يَسِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 they	 opened	 their	 belongings	
they	 found	 that	 their	 means	 had	 been	
returned	to	them;	they	said,	“O	our	father!	
What	more	can	we	ask	 for?	Here	are	 our	
means	 returned	 to	 us;	 we	 may	 get	 the	
provision	 for	 our	 homes	 and	 guard	 our	
brother,	and	get	a	camel-load	extra;	giving	
all	these	is	insignificant	for	the	king.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	unhoñ	ne	apnā	asbāb	 kholā	apni	
pooñji	pāyi	ke	un	ko	pher	di	gayi	hai	bole	
aey	hamāre	 bāp!	Ab	ham	aur	 kyā	chāheñ	
yeh	hai	hamāri	pooñji	ke	hameñ	wāpas	kar	
di	gayi		aur	ham	apne	ghar	 ke	liye	ghalla	
layeñ	aur	apne	bhāi	ki	hifāzat	kareñ	aur	ek	
ooñt	kā	bojh	aur	ziyādah	pāyeñ	yeh	denā	
bādshāh	ke	sāmne	kuchh		nahiñ

arabicText: قَالَ لَنْ أُرْسِلَهُۥ مَعَكُمْ حَتَّىٰ تُؤْتُونِ مَوْثِقًۭا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ لَتَأْتُنَّنِى بِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن يُحَاطَ بِكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّآ ءَاتَوْهُ مَوْثِقَهُمْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“I	shall	never	send	him	with	you	
until	you	give	me	an	oath	upon	Allah that	
you	will	bring	him	back	to	me,	unless	you	
are	 surrounded”;	 and	(recall)	 when	 they	
gave	him	their	oath	that	“Allah’s	guarantee	
is	upon	what	we	say.”	(*	He	knew	that	Bin	
Yamin	would	be	restrained.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 maiñ	 har	 giz	 ise	 tumhāre	 sāth	 na	
bhejooñ	ga	jab	tak	tum	mujhe	Allāh	kā	yeh
áhad	 na	 de	 do	 ke	 zaroor	ise	le	 kar	āaoge	
magar	yeh	ke	tum	ghir	jāo	(Majboor)	phir	
jab	unhoñ	ne	Y’aqoob ko áhad	de	diyā	kahā	
Allāh	kā	z	imma	hai	un	bātoñ	par	jo	ham	kah	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: وَقَالَ يَـٰبَنِىَّ لَا تَدْخُلُوا۟ مِنۢ بَابٍۢ وَٰحِدٍۢ وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ مِنْ أَبْوَٰبٍۢ مُّتَفَرِّقَةٍۢ ۖ وَمَآ أُغْنِى عَنكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنِ ٱلْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۖ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ ۖ وَعَلَيْهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	said,	“O	my	sons!	Do	not	enter	all	
by	one	gate	- and	enter	by	different	gates;	
I	cannot	save	you	against	Allah;	there	is	no	
command	but	that	of	Allah;	upon	Him	do	I	
rely;	 and	 all	 those	 who	 trust,	 must	 rely	
only	upon	Him.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahā	aey	mere	beto!	Ek	darwāze	se	na	dākhil	honā	aur	judā	judā	darwāzoñ	se	jānā	maiñ	
tumheñ	Allāh	se	bachā	nahiñ	saktā	hukm	to	sab	Allāh	hi	kā	hai	maiñ	ne	usi	par	bharosa	kiyā	aur	
bharosā	karne	wāloñ	ko	usi	par	bharosa	karnā	chahiye

arabicText: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ مِنْ حَيْثُ أَمَرَهُمْ أَبُوهُم مَّا كَانَ يُغْنِى عَنْهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا حَاجَةًۭ فِى نَفْسِ يَعْقُوبَ قَضَىٰهَا ۚ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَذُو عِلْمٍۢ لِّمَا عَلَّمْنَـٰهُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 they	 entered	 from	 the	 place	
where	their	father	had	commanded	them	to;	that	would	not	at	all	have	saved	them	against	Allah
- except	 that	 it	 was	 Yaqub’s	 secret	 wish,	 which	 he	 fulfilled;	 and	 indeed	 he	 is	 a	 possessor	 of	
knowledge,	due	to	Our	teaching,	but	most	people	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	dākhil	huye	jahāñ	se	un	ke	bāp	ne	hukm	diyā	thā	woh	kuchh		unheñ	Allāh	se	bachā	na	
saktā	hāñ	Y’aqoob ke	jee	ki	ek	khwāhish	thi	jo	us	ne	poori	Kar	li	aur	woh	sāhib-e-ìlm	hai	hamāre	
sikhāye	se	magar	aksar	log	nahiñ	Jānte

arabicText: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ ءَاوَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ أَخَاهُ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا۠ أَخُوكَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	entered	in	the	company	Yusuf,	he	seated	his	brother	close	to	him	and	said,	“Be	
assured,	I	really	am	your	brother	- therefore	do	not	grieve	for	what	they	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	woh	Yūsuf ke	pās	gaye	us	ne	apne	bhāi	ko	apne	pās	jagah	di	kahā	yaqin	jān	maiñ	hi	terā	
bhāi	hooñ	to	yeh	jo	kuchh		karte	haiñ	is	kā	gham	na	khā

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهَازِهِمْ جَعَلَ ٱلسِّقَايَةَ فِى رَحْلِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ أَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ أَيَّتُهَا ٱلْعِيرُ إِنَّكُمْ لَسَـٰرِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 he	 had	 provided	 them	 their	
provision,	 he	 put	 the	 drinking-cup	 in	 his	
brother’s	 bag,	 and	 then	 an	 announcer	
cried,	 “O	 people	 of	 the	 caravan!	 You	 are	
indeed	thieves!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 jab	 un	 kā	 sāmān	 muhayyā	 kar	 diya	
piyālā	apne	bhāi	ke	kajāwe	meiñ	rakh	diyā	
phir	ek	munādi	ne	nidā	ki	aey	qāfle	wālo!	
Be-shak		tum	chor	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ وَأَقْبَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم مَّاذَا تَفْقِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	answered	and	turned	towards	them,	
“What	is	it	you	cannot	find?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 aur	 un	 ki	 țaraf	 mutawajjeh	 huye,
“Tum	kyā	nahiñ	pāte?”

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ نَفْقِدُ صُوَاعَ ٱلْمَلِكِ وَلِمَن جَآءَ بِهِۦ حِمْلُ بَعِيرٍۢ وَأَنَا۠ بِهِۦ زَعِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	cannot	find	the	king’s	cup,	
and	for	him	who	brings	it	is	a	camel-load,	
and	I	am	its	guarantor.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	bādshāh	kā	paImāna	nahiñ	miltā	aur	
jo	usey	lāye	gā	us	ke	liye	ek	ooñt	kā	bojh	
hai	aur	maiñ	us	kā	zāmin		hooñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا جِئْنَا لِنُفْسِدَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كُنَّا سَـٰرِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “By	Allah,	 you	 know	 very	well	
that	we	did	not	come	here	to	cause	turmoil	
in	the	land,	and	nor	are	we	thieves!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 khudā	 ki	 qasam	 tumheñ	 khoob	
m’aloom	 hai	 ke	 ham	 zameen meiñ	 fasād	
karne	na	āaye		aur	na	ham	chor.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ فَمَا جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥٓ إِن كُنتُمْ كَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “And	 what	 shall	 be	 the	
punishment	for	it,	if	you	are	liars?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	phir	kya	sazā	hai	us	ki	agar	tum	jhoote	
ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥ مَن وُجِدَ فِى رَحْلِهِۦ فَهُوَ جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“The	punishment	for	it	is	that	he	
in	whose	bag	it	shall	be	found,	shall	himself	
become	a	slave	for	it;	this	is	how	we	punish	
the	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 us	 ki	 sazā	 yeh	 hai	 ke	 jis	 ke	 asbāb	
(Samān)	meiñ	mile	wohi	us	ke	badle	meiñ	
ghulām	 bane	 hamāre	 yahāñ	 zālimoñ	 ki	
yahi	sazā	hai

arabicText: فَبَدَأَ بِأَوْعِيَتِهِمْ قَبْلَ وِعَآءِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَخْرَجَهَا مِن وِعَآءِ أَخِيهِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كِدْنَا لِيُوسُفَ ۖ مَا كَانَ لِيَأْخُذَ أَخَاهُ فِى دِينِ ٱلْمَلِكِ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ نَرْفَعُ دَرَجَـٰتٍۢ مَّن نَّشَآءُ ۗ وَفَوْقَ كُلِّ ذِى عِلْمٍ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	he	 first	searched	 their	bags	before	his	
brother’s	 bag,	 then	 removed	 it	 from	 his	
brother’s	 bag;	 this	 was	 the	 plan	 We	 had	
taught	 Yusuf;	 he	 had	 no	 right	 to	 take	 his	
brother	 by	 the	 king’s	law,	 except	if	Allah
wills;	We	may	 raise	in	 ranks	whomever	We	will;	and	above	every	 possessor	 of	 knowledge	is	
another	scholar.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 awwal	 un	 ki	 khurjiyoñ	 (Thailoñ)	 se	
talāshi	 shuru’	 ki	 apne	 bhāi	 ki	 khurji	 se	
pahle	phir	 usey	apne	 bhāi	ki	 khurji	 se	nikāl	liyā	ham	ne	Yūsuf ko	 yahi	 tadbir	 batāyi	 bādshāhi	
qānoon	meiñ	usey	nahiñ	pahuñchtā	thā	ke	apne	bhāi	ko	le	le	magar	yeh	ke	khudā	chāhe	ham	jise	
chāheñ	darjoñ	buland	kareñ	aur	har	ìlm	wāle	se	ūpar	ek	ìlm	wālā	hai

arabicText: ۞ قَالُوٓا۟ إِن يَسْرِقْ فَقَدْ سَرَقَ أَخٌۭ لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ فَأَسَرَّهَا يُوسُفُ فِى نَفْسِهِۦ وَلَمْ يُبْدِهَا لَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ أَنتُمْ شَرٌّۭ مَّكَانًۭا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“If	he	steals,	then	indeed	his	brother	has	stolen	before”;	so	Yusuf	kept	this	in	his	heart	
and	did	not	reveal	it	to	them;	he	replied	within	himself,	“In	fact,	you	are	in	a	worse	position;	and	
Allah well	knows	the	matters	you	fabricate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bhāi	bole	agar	yeh	chori	kare	to	be-shak		is	se	pahle	ek	bhāi	chori	kar	chukā	hai	to	Yūsuf ne	yeh	
bāt	apne	dil	meiñ	rakhi	aur	un	par	z	āhir	na	ki	jee	meiñ	kahā	tum	badtar	jagah	ho	aur	Allāh	khoob	
jāntā	hai	jo	bāteñ	banāte	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْعَزِيزُ إِنَّ لَهُۥٓ أَبًۭا شَيْخًۭا كَبِيرًۭا فَخُذْ أَحَدَنَا مَكَانَهُۥٓ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَىٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	governor!	He	has	a	very	aged	father,	so	take	one	of	us	in	his	stead;	indeed	we	witness	
your	favours.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	“aey áziz!	Is	ke	ek	bāp	haiñ	boodhe	bade, to	ham	meiñ	us	ki	jagah	kisi	ko	le	lo; be-shak	ham	
tumhāre	ehsān	dekh	rahe	haiñ.”

arabicText: قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ أَن نَّأْخُذَ إِلَّا مَن وَجَدْنَا مَتَـٰعَنَا عِندَهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًۭا لَّظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said, “The	refuge	of	Allah from	that	we	
should	take	anyone	except	him	with	whom	
our	 property	was	 found	- we	would	 then	
surely	be	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	Khudā	ki	panāh	ke	ham	leñ	magar	usi	
ko	jis	ke	pās	hamārā	māl	milā	jab	to	ham	
zālim	hoñ	ge.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا ٱسْتَيْـَٔسُوا۟ مِنْهُ خَلَصُوا۟ نَجِيًّۭا ۖ قَالَ كَبِيرُهُمْ أَلَمْ تَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ أَبَاكُمْ قَدْ أَخَذَ عَلَيْكُم مَّوْثِقًۭا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ مَا فَرَّطتُمْ فِى يُوسُفَ ۖ فَلَنْ أَبْرَحَ ٱلْأَرْضَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْذَنَ لِىٓ أَبِىٓ أَوْ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ لِى ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	 they	did	not	anticipate	anything	
from	 him,	 they	 went	 away	 and	 started	
consulting	each	other;	their	eldest	brother	
said,	“Do	you	not	know	that	your	father	has	
taken	 from	 you	 an	 oath	 upon	 Allah,	 and	
before	this,	how	you	had	failed	in	respect	
of	Yusuf?	Therefore	 I	will	not	move	 from	
here	 until	 my	 father	 permits	 or	 Allah
commands	 me;	 and	 His	 is	 the	 best	
command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	is	se	nā	ummid	huye	alag	jākar	sar	
goshi	karne	lage	un	kā	badā	bhāi	bolā	kyā	
tumheñ	khabar	nahiñ	ke	 tumhāre	bāp	ne	
tum	 se	Allāh	 kā áhad	le	liyā	 thā	aur	is	se	
pahle	Yūsuf ke	haq	meiñ	tum	ne	kaisi	taqsir	
ki	to	maiñ	yahāñ	se	na	talooñ	ga	yahāñ	tak	
ke	 mere	 bāp	 mujhe	 ijāzat	 deñ	 yā	 Allāh	
mujhe	hukm	farmāye	aur	us	kā	hukm	sab	
se	behtar

arabicText: ٱرْجِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَبِيكُمْ فَقُولُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَآ إِنَّ ٱبْنَكَ سَرَقَ وَمَا شَهِدْنَآ إِلَّا بِمَا عَلِمْنَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِلْغَيْبِ حَـٰفِظِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Return to	your	father	and	then	submit,	‘O	
our	father!	Indeed	your	son	has	stolen;	we	
were	witness	 only	 to	what	we	 know	 and	
we	were	not	guardians	of	the	unseen.’
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	bāp	ke	pās	laut	kar	jāo	phir árz	karo	
ke	aey	hamāre	bāp!	be-shak		āap		ke	bete	
ne	chori	ki	aur	ham	to	itni	hi	bāt	ke	gawāh	
huye	the	jitni	hamāre	ìlm	meiñ	thi	aur	ham	
ghaib	ke	nigehbān	na	the

arabicText: وَسْـَٔلِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ ٱلَّتِى كُنَّا فِيهَا وَٱلْعِيرَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَقْبَلْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
‘And	ask	 the	 township	in	which	we	were,	
and	 the	 caravan	 in	 which	 we	 came;	 and	
indeed	we	are	truthful.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	basti	se	pooch	dekhiye	jis	meiñ	ham	the	aur	us	qāfile	se	jis	meiñ	ham	āaye	aur	ham	beshak	sachche	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًۭا ۖ فَصَبْرٌۭ جَمِيلٌ ۖ عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَأْتِيَنِى بِهِمْ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Yaqub,	“Your	souls	have	fabricated	an	
excuse	 for	 you;	 therefore	 patience	 is	
excellent;	it	is	likely	that	Allah will	bring	all	
*	 of	 them	 to	 me;	 undoubtedly	 only	 He	 is	 the	 All	 Knowing,	 the	 Wise.”	
(*	All	three	including	Yusuf.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	tumhāre	nafs	ne	tumheñ	kuchh		heela	banā	diyā	to	achchā	sabr	hai	qarib	hai	ke	Allāh	un	sab	
ko	mujh	se	lā	milāye	be-shak	Wohi		Ílm-o-Hikmat	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَسَفَىٰ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَٱبْيَضَّتْ عَيْنَاهُ مِنَ ٱلْحُزْنِ فَهُوَ كَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	turned	away from	them	and	said,	“Alas	- the	separation	from	Yusuf!”	and	his	eyes	turned	
white	with	sorrow,	he	therefore	kept	suppressing	his	anger.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	muñh	pherā	aur	kahā	hāye	afsos	Yūsuf ki	judāi	par	aur	us	ki	āankheñ	gham	se	safed	ho	
gayiñ	to	woh	gussa	khātā	rahā

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ تَفْتَؤُا۟ تَذْكُرُ يُوسُفَ حَتَّىٰ تَكُونَ حَرَضًا أَوْ تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْهَـٰلِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“By	Allah,	you	will	keep	remembering	Yusuf	till	your	health	fails	you	or	you	lose	your	
life.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	khudā	ki	qasam	āap		hameshā	Yūsuf ki	yād	karte	raheñ	ge	yahāñ	tak	ke	ghor	kināre	(Maut	
ke	Qareeb)	jā	lageñ	yā	jān	se	guzar	jāyeñ

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَشْكُوا۟ بَثِّى وَحُزْنِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“I	complain	of	my	worry	and	grief	only	to	Allah,	and	I	know	the	great	traits	of	Allah which	
you	do	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	maiñ	to	apni	pareshāni-aur-gham	ki	faryād	Allāh	hi	se	kartā	hooñ	aur	mujhe	Allāh	ki	woh	
shāneñ	m’alooom	haiñ	jo	tum	nahiñ	jānte

arabicText: يَـٰبَنِىَّ ٱذْهَبُوا۟ فَتَحَسَّسُوا۟ مِن يُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ وَلَا تَا۟يْـَٔسُوا۟ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَا۟يْـَٔسُ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	sons,	go	and	search	for	Yusuf	and	his	
brother,	and	do	not	lose	hope	in	the	mercy	
of	 Allah;	 indeed	 none	 lose	 hope	 in	 the	
mercy	 of	 Allah except	 the	 disbelieving	
people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 beto!	 Jāo	 Yūsuf aur	 us	 ke	 bhāi	 kā	
surāgh	 lagāo	 aur	 Allāh	 ki	 rahmat	 se	 nā	
ummid	na	ho	be-shak	Allāh	ki	rahmat	se	nā	
ummid	nahiñ	hote	magar	kāfir	log

arabicText: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْعَزِيزُ مَسَّنَا وَأَهْلَنَا ٱلضُّرُّ وَجِئْنَا بِبِضَـٰعَةٍۢ مُّزْجَىٰةٍۢ فَأَوْفِ لَنَا ٱلْكَيْلَ وَتَصَدَّقْ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَجْزِى ٱلْمُتَصَدِّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	when	they	reached	in	the	company	of	
Yusuf	they	said,	“O	governor!	Calamity	has	
struck	us	and	our	household,	and	we	have	
brought	goods	of	little	value,	so	give	us	the	
full	 measure	 and	 be	 generous	 to	 us;	
undoubtedly	Allah rewards	the	generous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	Yūsuf ke	 pās	 pahuñche	 bole	
aey áziz!	Hameñ	aur	hamāre	ghar	wāloñ	ko	
musibat	pahuñchi	aur ham	be	qadr	pooñji	
le	kar	āaye		haiñ	to	āap		hameñ	poorā	māp	
dijiye	aur	 ham	 par	 khairāt	 kijiye	 be-shak		
Allāh	khairāt	wāloñ	ko	sila	detā	hai

arabicText: قَالَ هَلْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا فَعَلْتُم بِيُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ إِذْ أَنتُمْ جَـٰهِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Are	you	aware	of	what	you	did	to	
Yusuf	 and	 his	 brother	 when	 you	 were	
unwise?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	kuchh		khabar	hai	tum	ne	Yousuf		aur	
us	 ke	 bhāi	 ke	 sāth	 kyā	 kiyā	 thā	 jab	 tum	
nādān	the

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَءِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يُوسُفُ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ يُوسُفُ وَهَـٰذَآ أَخِى ۖ قَدْ مَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “Are	 you,	 in	 truth	 you,	 really	
Yusuf?”	He	said,	“I	am	Yusuf	and	this	is	my	
brother;	indeed	Allah has	bestowed	favour	
upon	 us;	 undoubtedly	 whoever	 practices	
piety	 and	 patience	 - so	 Allah does	 not	
waste	the	wages	of	the	righteous.”

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ ءَاثَرَكَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَإِن كُنَّا لَخَـٰطِـِٔينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “By	 Allah,	 undoubtedly	 Allah
has	given	you	superiority	over	us,	and	we	
were	indeed	guilty.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	Khudā	ki	qasam	be-shak		Allāh	ne	āap		ko	ham	par	Fazilat	di	aur	be-shak		ham	khațāwār	the

arabicText: قَالَ لَا تَثْرِيبَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ يَغْفِرُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“There	is	no	reproach	on	you,	this	
day!	May	Allah forgive	you	- and	He	is	the	Utmost	Merciful,	of	all	those	who	show	mercy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	āaj	tum	par	kuchh	malāmat	nahiñ	Allāh	tumheñ	mu’āf	kare	aur	woh	sab	meherbānoñ	se	
badh	kar	meherbān	hai

arabicText: ٱذْهَبُوا۟ بِقَمِيصِى هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقُوهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِ أَبِى يَأْتِ بَصِيرًۭا وَأْتُونِى بِأَهْلِكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Take	along	this	shirt	of	mine	and	lay	it	on	my	father’s	face,	his	vision	will	be	restored;	and	bring	
your	entire	household	to	me.”	(Prophet	Yusuf	knew	that	this	miracle	would	occur.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Merā	yeh	Kurtā	le	jāo	isey		mere	bāp	ke	muñh	par	dālo	un	ki	āañkheiñ	khul	jāyeñ	gi	aur	apne	sab	
ghar	bhar	(ghar	wāloñ)	ko	mere	pās	le	āao

arabicText: وَلَمَّا فَصَلَتِ ٱلْعِيرُ قَالَ أَبُوهُمْ إِنِّى لَأَجِدُ رِيحَ يُوسُفَ ۖ لَوْلَآ أَن تُفَنِّدُونِ
englishTranslationText:
When	the	caravan	left	Egypt,	their	father	said	*,	“Indeed	I	sense	the	fragrance	of	Yusuf,	if	you	do	
not	call	me	senile.”	(*	Prophet	Yaqub	said	this	in	Palestine,	to	other	members	of	his	family.	He	could	
discern	the	fragrance	of	Prophet	Yusuf’s	shirt	from	far	away.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	qāfilā	Misr	se	judā	huā	yahāñ	un	ke	bāp	ne	kahā	be-shak	maiñ	Yūsuf ki	khushboo	pātā	hooñ	
agar	mujhe	yeh	na	kaho	ke	sath	(behak)	gayā

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ إِنَّكَ لَفِى ضَلَـٰلِكَ ٱلْقَدِيمِ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“By	Allah,	you	are	still	deeply	engrossed	in	the	same	old	love	of	yours.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bete	bole	khudā	ki	qasam	āap		apni	usi	purāni	khud	raftagi	(mahabbat)	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا ٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا خَـٰطِـِٔينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	our	father!	Seek	forgiveness	
for	our	sins,	for	we	were	indeed	guilty.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	aey	hamāre	bāp!	Hamāre	gunāhon	ki	
mu’āfi	 māñgye	 be-shak	 ham	 khațāwār	
haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ سَوْفَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكُمْ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“I	shall	soon	seek	forgiveness	for	
you	 from	my	 Lord;	indeed	He	 only	is	 the	
Oft	Forgiving,	the	Most	Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 jald	 maiñ	 tumhāri	 bakhshish	 apne	
Rab	 se	 chāhooñ	 gā	 be-shak	 wohi	 bakhsh	
ne	wālā	meherbān		hai

arabicText: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ ءَاوَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ أَبَوَيْهِ وَقَالَ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مِصْرَ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ءَامِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 when	 they	 all	 reached	 in	 Yusuf’s	
company,	he	kept	his	parents	close	to	him,	
and	 said,	 “Enter	 Egypt,	 if	 Allah wills,	 in	
safety.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	Yūsuf ke	pās	pahuñche us	ne	
apne	 māñ	 bāp	 ko	 apne	 pās	 jagah	 di	 aur	
kahā	Misr	meiñ	 dākhil	 ho	 Allāh	 chāhe	 to	
amān	ke	sāth

arabicText: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيْهِ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ وَخَرُّوا۟ لَهُۥ سُجَّدًۭا ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ هَـٰذَا تَأْوِيلُ رُءْيَـٰىَ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَعَلَهَا رَبِّى حَقًّۭا ۖ وَقَدْ أَحْسَنَ بِىٓ إِذْ أَخْرَجَنِى مِنَ ٱلسِّجْنِ وَجَآءَ بِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْبَدْوِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن نَّزَغَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَ إِخْوَتِىٓ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَطِيفٌۭ لِّمَا يَشَآءُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 he	 seated	 his	 parents	 on	 the	 throne,	
and	 they	 all	 prostrated	 before	 him;	 and	
Yusuf	 said,	 “O	 my	 father!	 This	 is	 the	
interpretation	 of	 my	 former	 dream;	 my	
Lord	has	made	it	true;	and	indeed	He	has	
bestowed	 favour	 upon	 me,	 when	 He	
brought	me	out	of	prison	and	brought	you	
all	from	the	village,	after	Satan	had	created	
a	 resentment	 between	 me	 and	 my	
brothers;	indeed	my	Lord	may	make	easy	
whatever	He	wills;	undoubtedly	He	is	the	All	Knowing,	the	Wise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	māñ	bāp	ko	takht	par	bithāyā	aur	woh	sab	us	ke	liye	sajde	meiñ	gire	aur	Yūsuf ne	kahā	
yeh	aey	mere	bāp!	Yeh	mere	pahle		khuwāb	ki	t’abir	hai	be-shak	 isey		mere	rab	ne	sachchā	kiyā	
aur	be-shak		us	ne	mujh	par	ehsān	kiyā	ke	mujhe	qaid	se	nikālā	aur	āap		sab	ko	gāoñ	se	le	āayā	
b’ad	is	ke	ke	shaițān	ne	mujh	meiñ	aur	mere	bhāiyoñ	meiñ	nā	chāqi	karā	di	thi	be-shak		merā	Rab	
jis	bāt	ko	chāhe	āsān	kar	de	be-shak	Wohi		Ílm-o-Hikmat	wālā	hai

arabicText: ۞ رَبِّ قَدْ ءَاتَيْتَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُلْكِ وَعَلَّمْتَنِى مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ فَاطِرَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَنتَ وَلِىِّۦ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ تَوَفَّنِى مُسْلِمًۭا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	Rab!	Be-shak	 tu	 ne	mujhe	ek	 saltanat	 di	aur	mujhe	 kuchh	 	 bātoñ	 kā	anjām	 nikālnā	
sikhāyā	aey	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ke	banāne	wāle!	Tu	merā	kām	banāne	wālā	hai	dunyā	aur	
āakhirat	meiñ	mujhe	musalmān	uthā	aur	un	se	milā	jo	tere	qurb-e-khās	ke	lāiq	haiñ

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ أَجْمَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ يَمْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
These	 are	 some	 tidings	 of	 the	 Hidden	 which	 We	 divinely	 reveal	 to	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him);	and	you	were	not	with	them	when	they	set	their	
task	and	when	they	were	scheming.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	kuchh		ghaib	ki	khabreñ	haiñ	jo	ham	tumhāri	țaraf		waḥi	karte	haiñ	aur	tum	un	ke	pās	na	the	
jab	unhoñ	ne	apnā	kām	pakkā	kiyā	tha	aur	woh	dāoñ	chal	rahe	the

arabicText: وَمَآ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَوْ حَرَصْتَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	however	much	you	long	for,	most	men	will	not	accept	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	aksar	āadmi	tum	kitnā	hi	chāho	Imān na	layeñ	ge

arabicText: وَمَا تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
You	do	not	ask	them	any	fee	in	return	for	
it;	 this	 is	 not	 but	 an	 advice	 to	 the	 entire	
world.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	 is	 par	 un	 se	 kuchh	 ujrat	 nahiñ	
māñgte	yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	sāre	jahāñ	ko	
nasihat.

arabicText: وَكَأَيِّن مِّنْ ءَايَةٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ يَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهَا وَهُمْ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	how	many	signs	exist	in	the	heavens	
and	 the	 earth,	 over	 which	 most	 people	
pass	and	remain	unaware	of	them!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitni	 nishaniyañ	 haiñ	 āasmānoñ	 aur	
zameen	 meiñ	 ke	 log	 un	 par	 guzarte	 haiñ	
aur un	se	be	khabar	rahte	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا يُؤْمِنُ أَكْثَرُهُم بِٱللَّهِ إِلَّا وَهُم مُّشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	most	of	them	are	such	that	they	do	not	
believe in	 Allah except	 while	 ascribing	
partners	(to	Him)!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aksar	woh	haiñ	ke	Allāh	par	
yaqin	nahiñ	lāte	magar	shirk	karte	huye
